body_html:
ccmake ../ brings me something weird:

I have to manually specify where are the third_party packages' source folders. ( I didn't use the submodules in third_party directly, but git clone out all third party packages by myself. For instance, FP16 ).

 CONFU_DEPENDENCIES_BINARY_DIR   ....../pytorch/build/confu-deps                                                                                 
 CONFU_DEPENDENCIES_SOURCE_DIR   ....../pytorch/build/confu-srcs 
......
glog_DIR                         ....../glog/build
body_text:
ccmake ../ brings me something weird:
I have to manually specify where are the third_party packages' source folders. ( I didn't use the submodules in third_party directly, but git clone out all third party packages by myself. For instance, FP16  ).
 CONFU_DEPENDENCIES_BINARY_DIR   ....../pytorch/build/confu-deps                                                                                 
 CONFU_DEPENDENCIES_SOURCE_DIR   ....../pytorch/build/confu-srcs 
......
glog_DIR                         ....../glog/build
body:
`ccmake ../` brings me something weird:

I have to manually specify where are the third_party packages' source folders. ( I didn't use the submodules in [third_party](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/tree/master/third_party) directly, but git clone out all third party packages by myself. For instance, [FP16](https://github.com/Maratyszcza/FP16)  ).


```
 CONFU_DEPENDENCIES_BINARY_DIR   ....../pytorch/build/confu-deps                                                                                 
 CONFU_DEPENDENCIES_SOURCE_DIR   ....../pytorch/build/confu-srcs 
......
glog_DIR                         ....../glog/build 
```
